title: Practice-Based Continuing Education Program for Enhancing Healthcare Professionals' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Core theories and practical experience in medicine and public health
context.additional_context: Educational environment focused on collaboration and practical case analysis using digital devices

learning_goals: Complex problems encountered in actual medical settings are analyzed and solutions proposed through project-based learning
Evidence-based practice guidelines are applied to develop strategies for improving patient outcomes

Within six months, learners collaborate with at least three medical/nursing professionals (doctors, nurses, physical therapists, etc.) to produce a patient treatment protocol improvement plan (minimum 10-page report + execution plan) that achieves an "Excellent" grade (4/5 scale) in at least four of the five predefined competency evaluation criteria (communication, collaboration, problem-solving, leadership, cultural sensitivity).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
